understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if the _journalSerializer is not null, it returns _journalSerializer, otherwise it returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for providing a Serializer object based on the configuration set for _journalSerializer. If a specific Serializer is configured, it will be returned, otherwise a default JavaSerializer will be used. This method is part of the process of creating a Prevayler instance according to the configuration set.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option is used when creating a Prevayler instance in the create() method. It is passed as a parameter to the PrevaylerImpl constructor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is dependent on when the create() method is called to create a new Prevayler instance. The frequency can vary based on the application's usage patterns.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how the PrevaylerImpl instance handles transaction deep copying. Depending on the value set for _transactionDeepCopyMode, there may be differences in memory usage and performance.
